thread.title: Ben Roethlisberger trolls NFL with fake cell phone during game
thread.title_full: Ben Roethlisberger trolls NFL with fake cell phone during game

author: jordan.heck@performgroup.com (Jordan Heck)
title: Ben Roethlisberger trolls NFL with fake cell phone during game
text:
Ben Roethlisberger trolls NFL with fake cell phone during game Sporting News 5 hrs ago jordan.heck@performgroup.com (Jordan Heck) © Provided by Sporting News Steelers quarterback Ben Roethlisberger had some fun Monday night by holding what is clearly not a cell phone up to his ear.
AdChoices
Well done, Ben Roethlisberger. Having fun with reports he had a cell phone on sideline during Steelers' last game. pic.twitter.com/W5CgYbLD3h
— Kevin Seifert (@SeifertESPN) October 13, 2015
MORE: Fantasy QB rankings for Week 6 | What happened to those 18 seconds?
This comes after there was some controversy during the Steelers' Thursday night game a week ago against the Ravens. Cameras caught Roethlisberger playing with something that kind of looked like a phone during the game. The use of cell phones on the sideline is not allowed by the league.
The NFL actually investigated the issue to see if what Roethlisberger was holding was indeed a cell phone. They determined it was not and he was holding a play sheet instead.
Coach Mike Tomlin chuckled when he saw Roethlisberger's fake phone Monday night.
